tool.name: FPStep2
tool.description: Predict the copy number of gene families present in the predicted genome for each study sequence.

param.name: input_tree
param.label: Tree file
param.help: The full reference tree in newick format containing both study sequences (i.e. ASVs or OTUs) and reference sequences (FPStep1 output tree).

validator.message: A built-in database is not available

param.name: function
param.label: Function table
param.help: 16S : 'EC' or/and 'KO' should be at least chosen (Metacyc pathway analysis or/and Kegg pathway analysis. Others values are optionnal. ITS and 18S : 'EC' only available.

validator.message: 'EC' or 'KO' must be at least selected. Other tables are optionnal

param.name: hsp_method
param.label: HSP method
param.help: HSP method to use."mp": predict discrete traits usingmax parsimony. "emp_prob": predict discrete traits based on empirical state probabilities across tips. "subtree_average": predict continuous traits using subtree averaging. "pic": predict continuous traits with phylogentic independent contrast. "scp": reconstruct continuous traits using squared-change parsimony (default: mp).

tool.help:
@HELP_LOGO@
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
What it does
Prediction of functional abundances based solely on the sequences of marker genes with `PICRUSt2 <https://github.com/picrust/picrust2>`_.
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Context
The second step of Picrust2 consists to run hidden-state prediction (hsp) to predict gene family abundances with `castor-R <https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/castor/index.html>`_ of each OTUs constructed elsewhere in a reference phylogenetic tree (FPStep1).
.. class:: infomark page-header h2
Inputs/Outputs
.. class:: h3
Inputs
**Tree file** (format newick `nxh <https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newick_format>`_):
The phylogenetic tree of insert sequences (FPStep 1 output : FPStep1_tree.nwk)
**OTUs biom file**:
The OTUs biom file (format `biom1 <http://biom-format.org/documentation/format_versions/biom-1.0.html>`_).
This file can be obtained in particular with the FROGS pipeline.
**Function table**:
If the genetic marker studied is 16S RNA gene: Which default pre-calculated count table to use (one of 'COG', 'EC', 'KO', 'PFAM', 'TIGRFAM', 'PHENO'). For ITS and 18S, EC only available.
The 4th step uses the Metacyc and Kegg databases to calculate the abundance of metabolic pathways. You must therefore select at least 'EC' or 'KO'.
.. class:: h3
Outputs
**Output marker file**:
Output table of predicted marker gene copy numbers per study sequence in input tree. (FPStep2_marker_nsti_predicted.tsv)
Marker gene copies number prediction is used to normalize the counting matrices of the gene families. For example, if the OTUs have 2 16S copies, the gene families in the function file for this otu will be divided by 2.
**Output function file**:
Output table with predicted abundances per study sequence in input tree. (FPStep2_predicted_functions.tsv)
@HELP_CONTACT@
